document_title: Cystitis: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and prevention
subsection_content:
When suffering from cystitis, the patient may experience symptoms such as:
Urinating more times a day than usual. Only a little urine comes out each time; Hematuria, cloudy urine or strong odor; Feeling pain or burning when urinating; Always feel the need to urinate urgently; Lower abdominal pain; Daytime enuresis in children.; Mild fever
Symptoms of cystitis may be transient and often confused with other diseases. If you have painful urination or your urine is mixed with blood, you need to go to the hospital to check the health of your urinary tract.
You may be interested in: Acute cystitis: Causes and symptoms
